description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Decommission Program Manager, you will enable a responsive and predictable supply chain supporting a large and complex data network. You will use your experience to drive both process and operational improvements in multiple facets of the Supply Chain and Reverse Logistics.

In this role, you will focus on network decommission and be responsible for global operations of internal reverse logistics that support Google’s network operations. You will work with vendor partners, providing definition and oversight for an entire program of decommission projects.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in program management working in supply chain within technical/networking fields.
  • Experience in ERP and WMS supply chain and inventory management functions.
  • Experience with reverse logistics, decommissioning, retrofit, and upgrade and redeployment of used equipment or products.
  • Ability to travel internationally.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Excellent organizational and project management skills.
  • Knowledge of networking telecommunications equipment.
  • Ability to effectively manage project plans, timelines, and costs.
responsibilities:
• Be responsible for global operations of network decommission programs.
  • Work closely with vendors and internal stakeholders to drive scheduling and execution.
  • Drive development and documentation of processes.
  • Focus on the customer.
  • Communicate effectively with highly technical management teams.
title: Decommission Program Manager, Network Operations Supply Chain
